title: An 18-month Review of ClusterMarket(TM) as an Instrument Scheduling and Project Management Tool for Brigham Young Universityâ€™s Electron Microscopy Facility
content: ClusterMarketTM [1], an online platform tailored for lab management, underwent an in-depth evaluation as a potential solution for addressing the multifaceted needs of Brigham Young University's (BYU) Electron Microscopy (EM) Facility [2]. The EM facility, which currently manages three scanning electron microscopes (SEMs), one Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM), several pieces of ancillary sample preparation equipment, conference rooms, manages over 70 active research projects, and over 130 individual users, sought an integrated solution to streamline operations and enhance efficiency. We present a comprehensive review of ClusterMarket's performance, after 18 months of use, in meeting the diverse needs of the facility, along with insights into its strengths and areas for improvement, particularly in data reporting capabilities.
